summary: "Rosemary's Baby" is a 1968 horror movie by Roman Polanski, based on Ira Levin's book. Mia Farrow plays a new mom who thinks her neighbors are in a Satanic cult and want her baby for a ritual. Shot mostly in Los Angeles, the film was a hit and won awards, including an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress (Ruth Gordon). It's now seen as one of the best horror films ever and is preserved in the US National Film Registry. It started a franchise with a TV sequel, a prequel, and a miniseries.
title: Rosemary's Baby (film)
